title: How can illness and pain lead to magical and miraculous phenomena?
first_phrase: In this excerpt, the author talks about the perception of illness and pain in the context of spiritual development. They discuss how with a supreme attention to one's own interiority and an attitude of absolute vitality, the healing forces can be directed towards the self, instead of just being limited to physiological systems. This can result in the ability to perform miraculous acts of healing like neutralizing poisons or closing wounds instantly. The author cites the example of the yogi Milarepa, who was able to project the potency of a poison out of his body and onto a door, which crumbled instantly upon impact. The author concludes by stating that the power of death and initiation is one and the same in many traditions.

last_phrase: In conclusion, by focusing on our inner selves and adopting a fearless and resilient attitude even in the face of illness and pain, we can tap into our body's natural healing powers and transform moments of crisis into opportunities for growth and transcendence. As Plutarch once said, death and initiation share a common purpose, and those who overcome their fear and embrace the transformative power of suffering can access moments of enlightenment and spiritual awakening.
